text: Svante Pääbo (; born 20 April 1955) is a Swedish geneticist. His works focused on evolutionary genetics. He is one of the founders of paleogenetics. He has worked on the Neanderthal genome. He is also an adjunct professor at Okinawa Institute of Science and Technology, Japan. In 1998, he was elected a member of the Academia Europaea. In 2022, he won the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine for his works about genomes of extinct hominins and human evolution. Svante Pääbo is bisexual.‘Neanderthal Man’ — Nobel Prize winner Svante Pääbo revolutionized anthropology. Here is a look back at his groundbreaking 2014 memoir ==References== Category:1955 births Category:Living people Category:Swedish academics Category:Geneticists Category:Members of Academia Europaea Category:Scientists from Stockholm Category:LGBT Nobel Prize winners
title: Svante Pääbo
